#Text=Morillon
#Text=Morillon
#Text=is a small mountain commune in the Haute Savoie department of the French Alps .
#Text=The town consists of about 500 year round residents engaged primarily in agriculture and tourist service business .
#Text=It has recently gained fame as the home town of skier Antoine Deneriaz the 2006 Olympic Downhill Gold Medalist .
#Text=The town has a 15th century Church that has recently been remodeled , it is also home to a number of small restaurants and a gondola that links it to the Grand Massif ski areas .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By Road
#Text=- Driving distance from Calais to Morillon 537 miles ( approx 7hrs30 )
#Text=From Calais , take A26 Motorway towards Reims and Troyes , then Dijon , Mâcon then ‘ Autoroute Blanche ’ Motorway ( A40 Mâcon – Cluses ) Exit Cluses Scionzier .
#Text=Follow signs to Samoens .
#Text=After the Chatillon pass , follow signs to Morillon .
#Text=It takes approximately 15 minutes from the motorway exit to Morillon .
#Text=By Rail
#Text=- Cluses 20km - Shuttle bus to Morillon +33 450 98 07 81 or Taxi +33 450 34 90 90 www.giffre-transports.com - Cost is 27 € daytime/midweek and 35 € nights and w/e ( for 1 to 4 people ) .
#Text=Airports

#Text=- Geneva 55km - Shuttle bus ( about 62€ per pers return children 4-12 half-price)For further information on car parking , transfers , etc : www . gva . ch/en ( then select Transportation in menu ) .
#Text=Taxi
#Text=, ☏ +33450349090 , fax : +33450971443 , ✉ info@giffre-transports.com .
#Text=Www.giffre-transports.com , - Cost is c € 71 daytime/midweek and c € 100 nights and w/e ( for 1 to 2 people ) Lyon Saint-Exupery 190 km .
#Text=Get around

#Text=Morillon is quite small and once you have arrived you can easily get around on foot , however and especially if you are here in the winter and there is not enough snow to ski you will want a rental car to be able to fully enjoy the surrounding area and keep from going mad having to watch French television .
#Text=See
#Text=Le Bourg : Around the St Christopher church ( 16th century ) the school and Town Hall , the solid bourgeoise houses have now become commercial premises .
#Text=Winter

#Text=Skiing , both cross country and downhill are the primary winter sports in Morillon , the resort website provided in both French and English is located here : and covers the ski area in depth as well as the possibilities of linking up on skis with the surrounding areas that comprise " Le Grand Massif .
#Text=Kevin 's Sports
#Text=Also located in " le Messidor " this sports shop operates primarily in the winter months as a ski shop .
#Text=Twinner Sports
#Text=operated year round by the second local ski hero Phillipe Vernert this is the closest shop to the ski lift and one of the best in town .
#Text=There is a lively farmers market on Friday mornings in Morillon with local produce , pastries , cheeses , and meats .
#Text=Eat
#Text=With in Morillon and its environs lay a number of very good a well priced restaurants , almost all of them specializing in local dishes or Pizza .
#Text=Among the best are :
#Text=Le Potet
#Text=across the river in Verchaix , 10-15€ for entrées
#Text=Le Tourne Piere
#Text=locate a few meters from the center of town , 12-20€ for entrées
#Text=A wide variety of prepared take away food is also available from R. Roux at the far edge of town and the local Hyper-Markets .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Bar Le Parisian
#Text=- this bar is centrally located across from the church , it is a full service bar run by the Wife of the Current Mayor ( 2006 )
#Text=Le Puzze
#Text=- Located just across from the telecabin this bar is popular with English tourists and serves a limited lunch and dinner menu .
#Text=Le Tomawack
#Text=- The only club in the village .
#Text=This was a Discotech located next to the river and was frequented by locals and tourists alike in the area .
#Text=With prime operating hours between 12-5am on Friday and Saturday nights it was not to be missed .
#Text=Unfortunately this has recently burnt down .
